definition: to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Creativity and originality have put Taiwan's music scene ahead.
sentences.chinese: 创意和原创性让台湾歌坛发展持续向前进。

sentences.english: To come up with more creative and innovative designs?
sentences.chinese: 还是想出更原创性和革新性的设计？

sentences.english: He was original even in the way he found his pleasures.
sentences.chinese: 即使在发现乐趣方面，他也是有原创性的。

sentences.english: Exclusive criteria included articles with repetitive research and non-original study.
sentences.chinese: 重复性研究和缺乏原创性的研究。

sentences.english: Create original content for the social media outreach.
sentences.chinese: 在大众媒体中制造原创性的内容。

sentences.english: On the other, I'm not sure how original it is.
sentences.chinese: 而在另一方面，我并不确定它到底有多大的原创性。

sentences.english: Plato's poetics are original and far-reaching in the world.
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图的诗论具有原创性，对后世影响深远。

sentences.english: The value of ancient literature theory consists in its original creativity.
sentences.chinese: 古代文学理论的价值在于其原创性。

sentences.english: Perhaps most striking of all its qualities is its potent originality.
sentences.chinese: 这幅作品最另人惊异的特质恐怕是其强大的原创性。

sentences.english: It's here that I wonder about the originality of the finding.
sentences.chinese: 就是在这点上我怀疑这项研究的原创性。

sentences.english: One is the creative aspect of culture, the living culture that is ongoing and innovative.
sentences.chinese: 一方面是文化的原创性，即不断创新的当代文化。

definition: innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
